text: 18 It was the beginning of February ; and Anne , having been a month in Bath , was growing very eager for news from Uppercross and Lyme .
text_tokenized: 18 It was the beginning of February ; and Anne , having been a month in Bath , was growing very eager for news from Uppercross and Lyme .

text: She wanted to hear much more than Mary had communicated .
text_tokenized: She wanted to hear much more than Mary had communicated .

text: It was three weeks since she had heard at all . She only knew that Henrietta was at home again ; and that Louisa , though considered to be recovering fast , was still in Lyme ; and she was thinking of them all very intently one evening , when a thicker letter than usual from Mary was delivered to her ; and , to quicken the pleasure and surprise , with Admiral and Mrs Croft 's compliments .
text_tokenized: It was three weeks since she had heard at all . text: The Crofts must be in Bath !
text_tokenized: The Crofts must be in Bath !

text: A circumstance to interest her .
text_tokenized: A circumstance to interest her .

text: They were people whom her heart turned to very naturally .
text_tokenized: They were people whom her heart turned to very naturally .

text: " What is this ? " cried Sir Walter .
text_tokenized: " What is this ? " cried Sir Walter .

text: " The Crofts have arrived in Bath ?
text_tokenized: " The Crofts have arrived in Bath ?

text: The Crofts who rent Kellynch ?
text_tokenized: The Crofts who rent Kellynch ?

text: What have they brought you ? " " A letter from Uppercross Cottage , Sir .
text_tokenized: What have they brought you ? " " A letter from Uppercross Cottage , Sir .

text_tokenized: " Oh !

text: those letters are convenient passports .

text: They secure an introduction .
text_tokenized: They secure an introduction .

text: I should have visited Admiral Croft , however , at any rate .
text_tokenized: I should have visited Admiral Croft , however , at any rate .

text: I know what is due to my tenant .
text_tokenized: I know what is due to my tenant .

text: Anne could listen no longer ; she could not even have told how the poor Admiral 's complexion escaped ; her letter engrossed her .
text_tokenized: Anne could listen no longer ; she could not even have told how the poor Admiral 's complexion escaped ; her letter engrossed her .

text: It had been begun several days back . " February 1st .
text_tokenized: It had been begun several days back . " February 1st .

text: " My dear Anne,--I make no apology for my silence , because I know how little people think of letters in such a place as Bath .
text_tokenized: " My dear Anne,--I make no apology for my silence , because I know how little people think of letters in such a place as Bath .

text: You must be a great deal too happy to care for Uppercross , which , as you well know , affords little to write about .
text_tokenized: You must be a great deal too happy to care for Uppercross , which , as you well know , affords little to write about .

text: We have had a very dull Christmas ; Mr and Mrs Musgrove have not had one dinner party all the holidays . I do not reckon the Hayters as anybody .
text_tokenized: We have had a very dull Christmas ; Mr and Mrs Musgrove have not had one dinner party all the holidays . I do not reckon the Hayters as anybody .

text: The holidays , however , are over at last
text_tokenized: The holidays , however , are over at last

text: : I believe no children ever had such long ones .
text_tokenized: : I believe no children ever had such long ones .

text: I am sure I had not .
text_tokenized: I am sure I had not .

text: The house was cleared yesterday , except of the little Harvilles ; but you will be surprised to hear they have never gone home .
text_tokenized: The house was cleared yesterday , except of the little Harvilles ; but you will be surprised to hear they have never gone home .

text: Mrs Harville must be an odd mother to part with them so long .
text_tokenized: Mrs Harville must be an odd mother to part with them so long .

text: I do not understand it .
text_tokenized: I do not understand it .

text: They are not at all nice children , in my opinion ; but Mrs Musgrove seems to like them quite as well , if not better , than her grandchildren .
text_tokenized: They are not at all nice children , in my opinion ; but Mrs Musgrove seems to like them quite as well , if not better , than her grandchildren .

text: What dreadful weather we have had !
text_tokenized: What dreadful weather we have had !

text: It may not be felt in Bath , with your nice pavements ; but in the country it is of some consequence .
text_tokenized: It may not be felt in Bath , with your nice pavements ; but in the country it is of some consequence .

text: I have not had a creature call on me since the second week in January , except Charles Hayter , who had been calling much oftener than was welcome .
text_tokenized: I have not had a creature call on me since the second week in January , except Charles Hayter , who had been calling much oftener than was welcome .

text: Between ourselves , I think it a great pity Henrietta did not remain at Lyme as long as Louisa ; it would have kept her a little out of his way .
text_tokenized: Between ourselves , I think it a great pity Henrietta did not remain at Lyme as long as Louisa ; it would have kept her a little out of his way .

text: The carriage is gone to - day , to bring Louisa and the Harvilles to - morrow .
text_tokenized: The carriage is gone to - day , to bring Louisa and the Harvilles to - morrow .

text: We are not asked to dine with them , however , till the day after ,
text_tokenized: We are not asked to dine with them , however , till the day after ,

text: Mrs Musgrove is so afraid of her being fatigued by the journey , which is not very likely , considering the care that will be taken of her ; and it would be much more convenient to me to dine there to - morrow .
text_tokenized: Mrs Musgrove is so afraid of her being fatigued by the journey , which is not very likely , considering the care that will be taken of her ; and it would be much more convenient to me to dine there to - morrow .

text: I am glad you find Mr Elliot so agreeable , and wish I could be acquainted with him too ; but I have my usual luck : I am always out of the way when any thing desirable is going on ; always the last of my family to be noticed .
text_tokenized: I am glad you find Mr Elliot so agreeable , and wish I could be acquainted with him too ; but I have my usual luck : I am always out of the way when any thing desirable is going on ; always the last of my family to be noticed .

text: What an immense time Mrs Clay has been staying with Elizabeth !
text_tokenized: What an immense time Mrs Clay has been staying with Elizabeth !

text: Does she never mean to go away ? But perhaps if she were to leave the room vacant , we might not be invited . Let me know what you think of this .
text_tokenized: Does she never mean to go away ? But perhaps if she were to leave the room vacant , we might not be invited . Let me know what you think of this .

text: I do not expect my children to be asked , you know . I can leave them at the Great House very well , for a month or six weeks .
text_tokenized: I do not expect my children to be asked , you know . I can leave them at the Great House very well , for a month or six weeks .

text: I have this moment heard that the Crofts are going to Bath almost immediately ; they think the Admiral gouty .
text_tokenized: I have this moment heard that the Crofts are going to Bath almost immediately ; they think the Admiral gouty .

text: Charles heard it quite by chance ; they have not had the civility to give me any notice , or of offering to take anything . I do not think they improve at all as neighbours . We see nothing of them , and this is really an instance of gross inattention .
text_tokenized: Charles heard it quite by chance ; they have not had the civility to give me any notice , or of offering to take anything . I do not think they improve at all as neighbours . We see nothing of them , and this is really an instance of gross inattention .

text: Charles joins me in love , and everything proper .
text_tokenized: Charles joins me in love , and everything proper .

text: Yours affectionately , " Mary M--- . "
text_tokenized: Yours affectionately , " Mary M--- . "

text: I am sorry to say that I am very far from well ; and Jemima has just told me that the butcher says there is a bad sore - throat very much about .
text_tokenized: I am sorry to say that I am very far from well ; and Jemima has just told me that the butcher says there is a bad sore - throat very much about .

text: I dare say I shall catch it ; and my sore - throats , you know , are always worse than anybody 's .
text_tokenized: I dare say I shall catch it ; and my sore - throats , you know , are always worse than anybody 's .

text: So ended the first part , which had been afterwards put into an envelope , containing nearly as much more . "
text_tokenized: So ended the first part , which had been afterwards put into an envelope , containing nearly as much more . "

text: I kept my letter open , that I might send you word how Louisa bore her journey , and now I am extremely glad I did , having a great deal to add .
text_tokenized: I kept my letter open , that I might send you word how Louisa bore her journey , and now I am extremely glad I did , having a great deal to add .

text: In the first place , I had a note from Mrs Croft yesterday , offering to convey anything to you ; a very kind , friendly note indeed , addressed to me , just as it ought ; I shall therefore be able to make my letter as long as I like . The Admiral does not seem very ill , and I sincerely hope Bath will do him all the good he wants .
text_tokenized: In the first place , I had a note from Mrs Croft yesterday , offering to convey anything to you ; a very kind , friendly note indeed , addressed to me , just as it ought ; I shall therefore be able to make my letter as long as I like . The Admiral does not seem very ill , and I sincerely hope Bath will do him all the good he wants .

text: I shall be truly glad to have them back again .
text_tokenized: I shall be truly glad to have them back again .

text: Our neighbourhood can not spare such a pleasant family .
text_tokenized: Our neighbourhood can not spare such a pleasant family .

text: But now for Louisa .
text_tokenized: But now for Louisa .

text: I have something to communicate that will astonish you not a little .
text_tokenized: I have something to communicate that will astonish you not a little .

text: She and the Harvilles came on Tuesday very safely , and in the evening we went to ask her how she did , when we were rather surprised not to find
text_tokenized: She and the Harvilles came on Tuesday very safely , and in the evening we went to ask her how she did , when we were rather surprised not to find

text: as well as the Harvilles ; and what do you think was the reason ? Neither more nor less than his being in love with Louisa , and not choosing to venture to Uppercross till he had had an answer from Mr Musgrove ; for it was all settled between him and her before she came away , and he had written to her father by Captain Harville . True , upon my honour !

text: Mrs Musgrove protests solemnly that she knew nothing of the matter . We are all very well pleased , however , for though it is not equal to her marrying Captain Wentworth , it is infinitely better than Charles Hayter ; and Mr Musgrove has written his consent , and Captain Benwick is expected to - day

text_tokenized: Mrs Harville says her husband feels a good deal on his poor sister 's account ; but , however , Louisa is a great favourite with both .

text: And this is the end , you see , of Captain Benwick 's being supposed to be an admirer of yours .
text_tokenized: And this is the end , you see , of Captain Benwick 's being supposed to be an admirer of yours .

text: How Charles could take such a thing into his head was always incomprehensible to me . I hope he will be more agreeable now .
text_tokenized: How Charles could take such a thing into his head was always incomprehensible to me . I hope he will be more agreeable now .

text: Certainly not a great match for Louisa Musgrove , but a million times better than marrying among the Hayters .
text_tokenized: Certainly not a great match for Louisa Musgrove , but a million times better than marrying among the Hayters .

text: " Mary need not have feared her sister 's being in any degree prepared for the news .
text_tokenized: " Mary need not have feared her sister 's being in any degree prepared for the news .

text_tokenized: She had never in her life been more astonished .

text: Captain Benwick and Louisa Musgrove !
text_tokenized: Captain Benwick and Louisa Musgrove !

text: It was almost too wonderful for belief , and it was with the greatest effort that she could remain in the room , preserve an air of calmness , and answer the common questions of the moment . Happily for her , they were not many .

text: " And pray what brings the Crofts to Bath ? " " They come on the Admiral 's account . He is thought to be gouty . " " Gout and decrepitude ! " said Sir Walter . " Poor old gentleman . " " Have they any acquaintance here ? " asked Elizabeth .
text_tokenized: " And pray what brings the Crofts to Bath ? " " They come on the Admiral 's account . He is thought to be gouty . " " Gout and decrepitude ! " said Sir Walter . " Poor old gentleman . " " Have they any acquaintance here ? " asked Elizabeth .

text: I do not know ; but I can hardly suppose that , at Admiral Croft 's time of life , and in his profession , he should not have many acquaintance in such a place as this .
text_tokenized: I do not know ; but I can hardly suppose that , at Admiral Croft 's time of life , and in his profession , he should not have many acquaintance in such a place as this .

text: " I suspect , " said Sir Walter coolly , " that Admiral Croft will be best known in Bath as the renter of Kellynch Hall .
text_tokenized: " I suspect , " said Sir Walter coolly , " that Admiral Croft will be best known in Bath as the renter of Kellynch Hall .

text: Elizabeth , may we venture to present him and his wife in Laura Place ?
text_tokenized: Elizabeth , may we venture to present him and his wife in Laura Place ?

text: " Oh , no !
text_tokenized: " Oh , no !

text: I think not .
text_tokenized: I think not .

text: Situated as we are with Lady Dalrymple , cousins , we ought to be very careful not to embarrass her with acquaintance she might not approve .
text_tokenized: Situated as we are with Lady Dalrymple , cousins , we ought to be very careful not to embarrass her with acquaintance she might not approve .

text: If we were not related , it would not signify ; but as cousins , she would feel scrupulous as to any proposal of ours .
text_tokenized: If we were not related , it would not signify ; but as cousins , she would feel scrupulous as to any proposal of ours .

text: We had better leave the Crofts to find their own level .
text_tokenized: We had better leave the Crofts to find their own level .

text: There are several odd - looking men walking about here , who , I am told , are sailors .

text: This was Sir Walter and Elizabeth 's share of interest in the letter ; when Mrs Clay had paid her tribute of more decent attention , in an enquiry after Mrs Charles Musgrove , and her fine little boys , Anne was at liberty . In her own room , she tried to comprehend it .

The high - spirited , joyous - talking Louisa Musgrove , and the dejected , thinking , feeling , reading , Captain Benwick , seemed each of them everything that would not suit the other .

text: They had been thrown together several weeks ; they had been living in the same small family party : since Henrietta 's coming away , they must have been depending almost entirely on each other , and Louisa , just recovering from illness , had been in an interesting state , and Captain Benwick was not inconsolable .

text: The conclusion of the whole was , that if the woman who had been sensible of Captain Wentworth 's merits could be allowed to prefer another man , there was nothing in the engagement to excite lasting wonder ; and if Captain Wentworth lost no friend by it , certainly nothing to be regretted . No , it was not regret which made Anne 's heart beat in spite of herself , and brought the colour into her cheeks when she thought of Captain Wentworth unshackled and free .

text: The Crofts had placed themselves in lodgings in Gay Street , perfectly to Sir Walter 's satisfaction . He was not at all ashamed of the acquaintance , and did , in fact , think and talk a great deal more about the Admiral , than the Admiral ever thought or talked about him .

text: The Crofts knew quite as many people in Bath as they wished for , and considered their intercourse with the Elliots as a mere matter of form , and not in the least likely to afford them any pleasure . They brought with them their country habit of being almost always together .
text_tokenized: The Crofts knew quite as many people in Bath as they wished for , and considered their intercourse with the Elliots as a mere matter of form , and not in the least likely to afford them any pleasure . They brought with them their country habit of being almost always together .

text: He was ordered to walk to keep off the gout , and Mrs Croft seemed to go shares with him in everything , and to walk for her life to do him good .
text_tokenized: He was ordered to walk to keep off the gout , and Mrs Croft seemed to go shares with him in everything , and to walk for her life to do him good .

text: Anne saw them wherever she went .
text_tokenized: Anne saw them wherever she went .

text: Lady Russell took her out in her carriage almost every morning , and she never failed to think of them , and never failed to see them . Knowing their feelings as she did , it was a most attractive picture of happiness to her . She always watched them as long as she could , delighted to fancy she understood what they might be talking of , as they walked along in happy independence , or equally delighted to see the Admiral 's hearty shake of the hand when he encountered an old friend , and observe their eagerness of conversation when occasionally forming into a little knot of the navy , Mrs Croft looking as intelligent and keen as any of the officers around her . Anne was too much engaged with Lady Russell to be often walking herself ; but it so happened that one morning , about a week or ten days after the Croft 's arrival , it suited her best to leave her friend , or her friend 's carriage , in the lower part of the town , and return alone to Camden Place , and in walking up Milsom Street she had the good fortune to meet with the Admiral .
text_tokenized: Lady Russell took her out in her carriage almost every morning , and she never failed to think of them , and never failed to see them . Knowing their feelings as she did , it was a most attractive picture of happiness to her . She always watched them as long as she could , delighted to fancy she understood what they might be talking of , as they walked along in happy independence , or equally delighted to see the Admiral 's hearty shake of the hand when he encountered an old friend , and observe their eagerness of conversation when occasionally forming into a little knot of the navy , Mrs Croft looking as intelligent and keen as any of the officers around her . Anne was too much engaged with Lady Russell to be often walking herself ; but it so happened that one morning , about a week or ten days after the Croft 's arrival , it suited her best to leave her friend , or her friend 's carriage , in the lower part of the town , and return alone to Camden Place , and in walking up Milsom Street she had the good fortune to meet with the Admiral .

text: " Ha ! is it you ?
text_tokenized: " Ha ! is it you ?

text: Thank you , thank you .
text_tokenized: Thank you , thank you .

text: This is treating me like a friend .
text_tokenized: This is treating me like a friend .

text: Here I am , you see , staring at a picture .
text_tokenized: Here I am , you see , staring at a picture .

text: I can never get by this shop without stopping .
text_tokenized: I can never get by this shop without stopping .

text: But what a thing here is , by way of a boat !
text_tokenized: But what a thing here is , by way of a boat !

text: Do look at it .
text_tokenized: Do look at it .

text: Did you ever see the like ?
text_tokenized: Did you ever see the like ?

text: What queer fellows your fine painters must be , to think that anybody would venture their lives in such a shapeless old cockleshell as that ?
text_tokenized: What queer fellows your fine painters must be , to think that anybody would venture their lives in such a shapeless old cockleshell as that ?

text: And yet here are two gentlemen stuck up in it mightily at their ease , and looking about them at the rocks and mountains , as if they were not to be upset the next moment , which they certainly must be .
text_tokenized: And yet here are two gentlemen stuck up in it mightily at their ease , and looking about them at the rocks and mountains , as if they were not to be upset the next moment , which they certainly must be .

text: I wonder where that boat was built ! " ( laughing heartily ) ; " I would not venture over a horsepond in it .
text_tokenized: I wonder where that boat was built ! " ( laughing heartily ) ; " I would not venture over a horsepond in it .

text: Well , " ( turning away ) , " now , where are you bound ?

text_tokenized: Can I go anywhere for you , or with you ?

text: I am glad they are not on this side of the way .

text: Sophy can not bear them . They played me a pitiful trick once : got away with some of my best men .

text: How do you like Bath , Miss Elliot ? It suits us very well .
text_tokenized: How do you like Bath , Miss Elliot ? It suits us very well .

text: We are always meeting with some old friend or other ; the streets full of them every morning ; sure to have plenty of chat ; and then we get away from them all , and shut ourselves in our lodgings ,
text_tokenized: We are always meeting with some old friend or other ; the streets full of them every morning ; sure to have plenty of chat ; and then we get away from them all , and shut ourselves in our lodgings ,

text: and draw in our chairs , and are snug as if we were at Kellynch , ay , or as we used to be even at North Yarmouth and Deal .

text: We do not like our lodgings here the worse , I can tell you , for putting us in mind of those we first had at North Yarmouth .

text: The wind blows through one of the cupboards just in the same way . " When they were got a little farther , Anne ventured to press again for what he had to communicate . She hoped when clear of Milsom Street to have her curiosity gratified ; but she was still obliged to wait , for the Admiral had made up his mind not to begin till they had gained the greater space and quiet of Belmont ; and as she was not really Mrs Croft , she must let him have his own way .

She hoped when clear of Milsom Street to have her curiosity gratified ; but she was still obliged to wait , for the Admiral had made up his mind not to begin till they had gained the greater space and quiet of Belmont ; and as she was not really Mrs Croft , she must let him have his own way .

text: As soon as they were fairly ascending Belmont , he began-- " Well , now you shall hear something that will surprise you .
text_tokenized: As soon as they were fairly ascending Belmont , he began-- " Well , now you shall hear something that will surprise you .

text: But first of all , you must tell me the name of the young lady I am going to talk about .
text_tokenized: But first of all , you must tell me the name of the young lady I am going to talk about .

text: That young lady , you know , that we have all been so concerned for .
text_tokenized: That young lady , you know , that we have all been so concerned for .

text: The Miss Musgrove , that all this has been happening to .
text_tokenized: The Miss Musgrove , that all this has been happening to .

text: Her Christian name : I always forget her Christian name .
text_tokenized: Her Christian name : I always forget her Christian name .

text: Anne had been ashamed to appear to comprehend so soon as she really did ; but now she could safely suggest the name of " Louisa .
text_tokenized: Anne had been ashamed to appear to comprehend so soon as she really did ; but now she could safely suggest the name of " Louisa .

text: " Ay , ay , Miss Louisa Musgrove , that is the name .
text_tokenized: " Ay , ay , Miss Louisa Musgrove , that is the name .

text: I wish young ladies had not such a number of fine Christian names .
text_tokenized: I wish young ladies had not such a number of fine Christian names .

text: I should never be out if they were all Sophys , or something of that sort . Well , this Miss Louisa , we all thought , you know , was to marry Frederick . He was courting her week after week .
text_tokenized: I should never be out if they were all Sophys , or something of that sort . Well , this Miss Louisa , we all thought , you know , was to marry Frederick . He was courting her week after week .

text: The only wonder was , what they could be waiting for , till the business at Lyme came ; then , indeed , it was clear enough that they must wait till her brain was set to right .
text_tokenized: The only wonder was , what they could be waiting for , till the business at Lyme came ; then , indeed , it was clear enough that they must wait till her brain was set to right .

text: But even then there was something odd in their way of going on .

text_tokenized: Instead of staying at Lyme , he went off to Plymouth , and then he went off to see Edward .

text: When we came back from Minehead he was gone down to Edward 's , and there he has been ever since .

text: We have seen nothing of him since November .

text: But now , the matter has take the strangest turn of all ; for this young lady , the same Miss Musgrove , instead of being to marry Frederick , is to marry James Benwick .
text_tokenized: But now , the matter has take the strangest turn of all ; for this young lady , the same Miss Musgrove , instead of being to marry Frederick , is to marry James Benwick .

text: An excellent , good - hearted fellow , I assure you ; a very active , zealous officer too , which is more than you would think for , perhaps , for that soft sort of manner does not do him justice . "

text: She had only meant to oppose the too common idea of spirit and gentleness being incompatible with each other , not at all to represent Captain Benwick 's manners as the very best that could possibly be ; and , after a little hesitation , she was beginning to say , " I was not entering into any comparison of the two friends , " but the Admiral interrupted her with-- " And the thing is certainly true . It is not a mere bit of gossip .

text: I fancy they are all at Uppercross . " This was an opportunity which Anne could not resist ; she said , therefore , " I hope , Admiral , I hope there is nothing in the style of Captain Wentworth 's letter to make you and Mrs Croft particularly uneasy .
text_tokenized: I fancy they are all at Uppercross . " This was an opportunity which Anne could not resist ; she said , therefore , " I hope , Admiral , I hope there is nothing in the style of Captain Wentworth 's letter to make you and Mrs Croft particularly uneasy .

text: It did seem , last autumn , as if there were an attachment between him and Louisa Musgrove ; but I hope it may be understood to have worn out on each side equally , and without violence .

text: I hope his letter does not breathe the spirit of an ill - used man . " " Not at all , not at all ; there is not an oath or a murmur from beginning to end . " Anne looked down to hide her smile . " No , no ; Frederick is not a man to whine and complain ; he has too much spirit for that .
